results.title: The Magic boomerang: Double trouble
results.creator_credit: Roger Mirams, David Baker and Pacific Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Magic Boomerang”.
One of a series made for children’s television. The story is set in a country town where the boy “hero” of the series, Nuggett, gets involved in a plot to defraud a man of some land. The whole plot is thwarted with the help of Nuggett and his friend and the magic boomerang. The owner and his land are saved in a happy ending.

results.title: The Magic billabong
results.creator_credit: Barbara Graham Productions and Garry Gibson
results.brief_description: Featuring koalas, kangaroos, echidnas and other Australian wildlife in their natural habitat. Ann Patchett presents information, songs, magic, games, counting and camping with Kookie and the Gumnut Babies, plus story reading from award winning children’s books including “Possum magic” as well as plenty of ideas for exciting things to do.

results.title: The Magic bean
results.creator_credit: Lyons Visual Aid Unit, John Ward, Peter Ringsted, Philip Taylor, Thelma Parker and Terence Weathers
results.brief_description: Explains the history of the use of coffee, how it spread throughout the world and the story of its social impact, especially in London in the 17th century, when coffee-houses were the meeting places of artists, scientists and politicians. Information on the coffee bean from plantation to cup is given, and how packing is important to preserve flavour and aroma.

results.title: The Magic balloons
results.creator_credit: Jacques Corbec and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A little boy sells balloons along the beach. In his fantasies the balloon takes on personalities. As the boy sleeps, a young couple walks off with his balloons, and when he wakes he goes in search of them. Most of the balloons have been burst, but he finally rescues one and together they escape. Designed to develop interpretation and expression in children of the significance of scenes and events. A film without words.

results.title: The Magic arts
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Film Australia and Bruce Petty
results.brief_description: Without commentary, this film sets out to show how art relates and intertwines in our daily lives. Each art form is looked at: weaving, sculpture, painting, live theatre, with quotations from writers and music scores, both classical and modern.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Suzanne Baker, Film Australia and Bruce Petty

results.title: The Madness of King George
results.creator_credit: Close Call Film Production, Stephen Evans, David Parfitt, Nicholas Hytner and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Alan Bennett, “The Madness of King George” stars Nigel Hawthorne as the ailing King and Helen Mirren as his wife Queen Charlotte. King George the Third, after he lost the American colonies in the War of Independence, succumbed to intermittent bouts of madness where his usual ordered and calm persona underwent a violent and obscene transformation. The Prince of Wales becomes a willing pawn in the plot to commit the King, and establish the Regency. This is a finely acted and sumptuous production of Bennett’s play. Ian Holm plays the Doctor called in to cure the King’s madness using methods which from a modern vantage were brutal and inhumane.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Close Call Film Production, Stephen Evans, David Parfitt, Nicholas Hytner and Ken Adam

results.title: The Mad Canadian
results.creator_credit: Bill Brind, ONF | NFB and Robert Fortier
results.brief_description: A tense, tight close-up of stunt man Ken Carter’s role on the stock-car racing track. Risking life and limb to rocket a car from a ramp over a parked line of cars takes more than the will to make a living. What else is involved is shown by the film as the camera looks and listens while the stunt man readies for his act and then makes his wild ride.

results.title: The Mackenzie file
results.creator_credit: Ken Little, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Curriculum Design and Development”.
One of a series of a second level course from the Faculty of Educational Studies, Open University. A wide range of ideas and practices in education is examined with a view to discovering consistencies and inconsistencies. This is followed by a review of the principles involved in curriculum development. Ends with a survey of the various constraints on curriculum development and the forces which generate change.

results.title: The Machine: master or slave
results.creator_credit: Educational Film Institute of the New York University and Walter Niebuhr
results.brief_description: Considers the problems that management faces in its approach to the human and financial facctors involved in technological progress. To what extent can unemployment be relieved by seeking larger markets, by adjustment of prices, wages, and dividends? How can management co-ordinate its own long-term self-interest with the needs of the workers and the consumer? Instead of attempting to answer these questions, the film poses them against the background of managerial organisation, asking the audience not to overlook the realities involved.
